In most cases, it's one of two things. Just In Ireland threatens Eurovision boycott if Israel takes part Topic: World Politics 1h ago 1 hours ago Thu 11 Sep 2025 at 3:39pm FBI releases CCTV images of man in search for Charlie Kirk's killer Topic: Law, Crime and Justice 41m ago 41 minutes ago Thu 11 Sep 2025 at 4:50pm Jacinta Nampijinpa Price attends fundraiser in Perth, avoids waiting media Topic: Liberal Party of Australia 3h ago 3 hours ago Thu 11 Sep 2025 at 2:04pm UK's Starmer fires ambassador to US over Epstein revelations Topic: World Politics 2h ago 2 hours ago Thu 11 Sep 2025 at 3:24pm Pub manager groped security guard 'countless' times, court told Topic: Courts 6h ago 6 hours ago Thu 11 Sep 2025 at 10:54am Cormann urges open mind about nuclear power amid climate debate Topic: Nuclear Energy 7h ago 7 hours ago Thu 11 Sep 2025 at 9:43am More Just In Everyone's Talking About... Slide 1 of 3 Charlie Kirk Popular conservative activist Charlie Kirk has been shot dead in the US. Kirk was a major proponent of Donald Trump and right-wing politics in America. He was speaking at an event at a Utah university when a gunman shot him dead. Slide 1 of 3 Murdoch succession Control of Rupert Murdoch's companies will fall to his eldest son after the media mogul's death. Lachlan Murdoch had been in a protracted fight with his three eldest siblings over control of the companies. The family has now agreed to a deal that would hand Lachlan full control. Slide 1 of 3 VMAs Lady Gaga won Artist of the Year at the 2025 VMAs. Mariah Carey won her first VMA (Best R&B song) and sang a medley of her greatest hits. Aerosmith's Steven Tyler and Yungblud performed a tribute of Ozzy Osbourne's greatest hits. Slide 1 of 3 NZ fugitive NZ man Tom Phillips has been killed in a shootout with police after four years on the run. The father fled into bushland in 2021 with his three young children. One of his children was taken into custody, while the other two received medical treatment. Slide 1 of 3 Life sentence Mushroom killer Erin Patterson has been sentenced to life in prison. She killed Heather Wilkinson and Gail and Don Patterson with a poisoned meal. She won't be eligible for parole until 2056. Slide 1 of 3 Blood moon Keen stargazers around the world have been dazzled by the sight of a "blood moon" lunar eclipse. The blood moon could be seen across Australia, Asia and parts of Europe. It's caused by rays of sunlight around the eclipse's shadow refracting onto the lunar surface. headline: Le RN réfléchit à une « loi d’amnistie » pour Marine Le Pen en cas d’arrivée au pouvoir
body: Article réservé aux abonnés Le RN réfléchit à une « loi d’amnistie » pour Marine Le Pen en cas d’arrivée au pouvoir JULIEN MUGUET POUR « LE MONDE » Plusieurs hauts responsables lepénistes confirment qu’une loi d’amnistie, ou une loi annulant l’exécution provisoire de l’inéligibilité, pourrait être défendue par une majorité Rassemblement national afin de favoriser le dessein présidentiel de sa championne. Article réservé aux abonnés Marine Le Pen, menacée par l’inéligibilité, obtient l’accélération de son calendrier judiciaire Article réservé aux abonnés Ce qui est reproché à Marine Le Pen dans l’affaire des assistants parlementaires européens du FN PHILL MAGAKOE/AFP Après l’assassinat de Charlie Kirk, le FBI a retrouvé l’arme du crime et diffuse des photos du suspect LAURENT VAN DER STOCKT POUR « LE MONDE » Live Article se déroulant en direct Benyamin Nétanyahou lors d’un déplacement dans une colonie Cisjordanie : « Il n’y aura pas d’Etat palestinien, cet endroit nous appartient » Jemal Countess/UPI/Newscom/SIPA Article réservé aux abonnés Emma Tucker, directrice du « Wall Street Journal », « une femme qui n’a peur de rien », pas même de Trump ou de la Maison Blanche Directrice de la rédaction du quotidien économique américain depuis deux ans, la journaliste britannique ne recule devant rien. Philippe Turpin/Photononstop La réforme pour restreindre l’accès à l’AME bloquée après une décision du conseil de l’Assurance-maladie L’examen des décrets devait permettre à l’Assurance-maladie d’émettre un avis consultatif. Les syndicats dénonçaient « l’absence de légitimité » du gouvernement démissionnaire à mettre en œuvre « de nouvelles orientations politiques ». Gallo Images via Getty Images Article réservé aux abonnés L’obésité est devenue la première forme de malnutrition chez les jeunes selon l’Unicef, qui dénonce les pratiques de l’industrie agroalimentaire Longtemps un fléau de pays riches, qui ont connu un changement très rapide des habitudes alimentaires à la fin du XXe siècle, l’obésité et le surpoids n’épargnent désormais aucune région du monde. podcast Épisode du 10 septembre 2025 Sébastien Lecornu pourra-t-il sortir le pays de la crise politique ? Écouter l'épisode Tribune Rémi Lefebvre Article réservé aux abonnés « La responsabilité personnelle d’Emmanuel Macron est largement engagée dans l’effondrement actuel du système politique » Rémi Lefebvre, professeur de science politique interroge « l’hubris et la démesure » du chef de l’Etat, qui ont, selon lui, autant contribué à la crise actuelle. 4 min de lecture Service Le Monde COURS DE GEOPOLITIQUE Comprendre le grand désordre mondial par les cartes avec Delphine Papin, rédactrice en chef au Monde. Donald Trump a, sans attendre l’enquête, mis en cause « l’extrême gauche ». 8 min de lecture Entretien Denis Cosnard et Pascal Riché Article réservé aux abonnés Gabriel Zucman : « Il va être très difficile de demander aux Français de faire des efforts tant que les milliardaires paieront si peu d’impôts » L’économiste est à l’origine du projet de taxation des plus hauts patrimoines défendu par la gauche. Dans un entretien au « Monde », il juge que « le nouveau premier ministre, Sébastien Lecornu, va devoir se saisir du projet de taxe sur les ultrariches ». 7 min de lecture Récit Alexandre Pedro et headline: Environment & Climate Change
body: Netanyahu speaks to Elizabeth Tsurkov day after her release from Iraq Tsurkov described to Netanyahu the harsh conditions of her captivity and expressed her hope for the return of all the hostages held in Gaza.

Lifelong geek, camera obsessive, Wordle bore Lance Ulanoff Editor-at-Large 35-year industry veteran and award-winning journalist Josie Watson Managing Editor, Lifestyle Smart home evangelist, multimedia journalist and internet safety and education advocate Matt Hanson Managing Editor, Core Tech Been building and breaking PCs for the past 30 years. Obsessed with trying to get PC games to run at 8K Rob Dwiar Managing Editor, TechRadar Gaming Gaming hardware editor of six years, PlayStation specialist, and video game landscapes expert Matt Bolton Managing Editor, Entertainment 14 years in tech journalism. Cinema fanatic and home picture-quality champion Roland Moore-Colyer Managing Editor, Mobile Computing 10+ years' experience in phones, computing, software and more Mark Wilson Senior news editor 20 years in tech journalism. First review was the Nokia N-Gage. Former cameras editor, current newshound Al Griffin US Senior Editor, Home Entertainment 25-plus years experience AV journalism and product testing Amelia Schwanke Senior Editor, Home Entertainment Home entertainment enthusiast and tech whiz with a business journalism background Mike McNally Chief Sub Editor 35 years as a writer and editor in newspapers, magazines and online Matt Evans Senior Fitness, Wellness and Wearables Editor Experienced editor, digital wellbeing enthusiast, accidental running shoe hoarder Graham Barlow Senior Editor, AI Over 25 years in tech journalism. Obsessed with AI and text adventures from the 1980s. James Pickard Senior Deals Editor Thrifty deals hunter for over a decade and Black Friday veteran who can't resist a good bargain on tech and games Mackenzie Frazier Senior Deals Editor Eight years working in e-commerce. Online shopping expert, bargain hunter, and mom-of-two John Loeffler Components Editor A CES 2020 Media Trailblazer covering all things computing and components Axel Metz Phones Editor iPhone guru, expert rumor tracker and curtain-wearing TikTok host Christian Guyton UK Computing Editor Six years spent writing about and building PCs Rhys Wood Hardware editor, TechRadar Gaming Writer on gaming hardware for over three years, gamepad fanatic, and video game soundtrack enthusiast Alex Whitelock Deals editor Eight-year e-commerce veteran. Helped thousands of readers save cash on the tech they love James Davidson Staff Writer, TV Hardware AV salesman turned writer. Always thinking of new ideas for novels Dashiell Wood Hardware writer, TechRadar Gaming Knowledge of all the latest gadgets with experience writing for the UK’s biggest gaming magazines VPN All VPN IPVanish takes its first step toward a RAM-only VPN network The EU has never been closer to agreeing on the scanning of your private chats – but how did we get here? Norton VPN could become much faster thanks to a feature many VPNs don't offer Now you see me, now you don’t – Mullvad introduces QUIC to disguise WireGuard traffic Nepal is the 8th country in 2025 to issue a social media ban – provoking an over 8,000% spike in VPN sign-ups X, WhatsApp, YouTube, and other social media platforms go dark in Turkey for 24 hours – and VPN usage spikes Surfsharks sent a graffiti artist to Shoreditch to teach you about the absurd simplicity of VPNs ALL VPN All TechRadar Pro Get the essential technology insights for your business, ranging from the latest news to in-depth buying advice Minisforum belatedly joins the Ryzen AI Max+ 395 race with a mini PC that can be rack-mounted, yes, rack-mounted in 2U Minisforum unveils MS-S1 Max with Ryzen AI Max+ 395, PCIe expansion, rack compatibility, strong ports, but no price for now. Pro This widely used Remote Monitoring tool is being used to deploy AsyncRAT to steal passwords A trojanized version of ScreenConnect is being shared via phishing, and later used to deploy AsyncRAT. Security Apple’s iPhone Air kills the SIM card: what this means for eSIM providers, telcos, and consumers This shift will put pressure on mobile operators to improve digital onboarding and reduce reliance on SIM distribution. Phone & Communications This long-exposed SonicWall flaw is being used to infect organizations with Akira ransomware - so patch now Multiple versions of SonicWall's SSLVPN firewalls are being targeted. Security ALL TECHRADAR PRO
